授業目的: The purpose of this course is for students to learn historical and modern international trade models and apply those models to trade policy.
到達目標:
Students will be able to
1. Explain the key takeaways of several international trade models,
2. Analyze past and current trade policy,
3. Write effect policy analysis.
授業の概要・背景:
In this class, students will learn an array of international trade models.  They will also apply trade theory to a variety of actual and hypothetical trade policies.  The course will place a particular emphasis on modern U.S. trade policy and the Japan-U.S. trade relationship.  Finally, students will create a policy proposal that uses all of the tools learned in the class.

An understanding of trade policy is vital for the success of public policy regulators, who are often at the forefront of setting trade policy and negotiating trade agreements.  Because of the globalization of business, future business leaders will also benefit from understanding trade policy.
